sen.j: 祭主（さいしゅ）とは、伊勢神宮にのみ置かれている神職の役職である。
sen.e: Saishu is a post of Shinto priesthood set up only in Ise Jingu Shrine.
Saishu was a post within Shinto priesthood that was set up exclusively in the Ise Jingu Shrine.
Saishu was a post within Shinto priesthood that was set up exclusively in the Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 古は令外官のひとつであったものである。
sen.e: In ancient times it was a one of Ryoge no kan (classes outside of the Ritsuryo system).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In ancient times, the post was classified as a Ryoge no kan (a class outside of the Ritsuryo system [a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code]).
sen.cmt: added description for "Ritsuryo system" inside brackets; added "classified" for clearer understanding; fixed grammar
sen.e: In ancient times, the post was classified as a Ryoge no kan (a class outside of the Ritsuryo system [a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code]).

sen.j: 近代以前は、代々中臣氏（大中臣氏）が任命され、神祇官神祇官（明治2年7月 政体書改正に伴い太政官から特立）が兼任した。
sen.e: The Nakatomi clan (the Onakatomi clan) had been appointed to the post for generations before the modern times and the jingikan (Shinto commissioner) (set up in July 1869 independently from Daijokan (Grand Council of State) with amendments to the Constitution of 1868) held the post concurrently.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「神祇官」は２度でありますが、一度のみ訳し出ししています。
sen.e: The Nakatomi clan (the Onakatomi clan) had been appointed to the post for generations before modern times, and the Jingikan (Shinto commissioner) (set up in July of 1869 independently from Daijokan (Grand Council of State) with the amendments to the Constitution of 1868) held the post concurrently.

The Nakatomi clan (the Onakatomi clan) had been appointed to the post for generations before modern times, and the Jingikan (Shinto commissioner) (set up in July of 1869 independently from Daijokan (Grand Council of State) with the amendments to the Constitution of 1868) held the post concurrently.

sen.j: 伊勢の神宮の祈年祭・月次祭・神嘗祭において、奉幣使として参向し、祝詞を奏上して、天皇の意思を祭神に伝えることを主たる役目とする。
sen.e: Its role is to visit shrines in Ise and recite a prayer to convey the wishes of the emperor to the enshrined deity in the events of Kinensai (prayer service for a good crop), Tsukinami-sai Festival, and Kannamesai Festival.

The role of the post was to visit shrines in Ise and recite prayers conveying the wishes of the emperor to the enshrined deity during the Kinensai (prayer service for a good crop), Tsukinami-sai Festival and Kannamesai Festival.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The role of the post was to visit shrines in Ise and recite prayers conveying the wishes of the emperor to the enshrined deity during the Kinensai (prayer service for a good crop), Tsukinami-sai Festival and Kannamesai Festival.

sen.j: 国家機関当時は、神宮式年遷宮に際しては、造神宮使・奉遷使を務めた。
sen.e: When the shrine was an organization of the state, Saishu was in charge of general affairs and transfer of a deity in the Ise Shrine in the event of Jingu shkiinen Sengu.
When the shrine was an organization of the state, the Saishu was in charge of general affairs and the transfer of a deity in the Ise Shrine during Jingu Shikinen Sengu.
When the shrine was an organization of the state, the Saishu was in charge of general affairs and the transfer of a deity in the Ise Shrine during Jingu Shikinen Sengu.

sen.j: 伊勢神宮のほかにも同名の役職が置かれる場合があったが、それらとは明確に区別される。
sen.e: The posts with the same name were set up in some shrines other than Ise Jingu Shrine but were definitely distinguished.
Posts using the name of Saishu were established in shrines other than Ise Jingu Shrine, but these posts were clearly different.
sen.cmt: The meaning of "definitely distinguished" is a little unclear, so I changed it to "clearly different"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Posts using the name of Saishu were established in shrines other than Ise-jingu Shrine, but these posts were clearly different.

sen.j: 現在の祭主は池田厚子であり、戦後は皇族出身の女性が就任している。
sen.e: Like Atsuko IKEDA, who now serves as Saishu, women originally from the Imperial family assume in the period after the Second world War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Atsuko IKEDA, for example, now serves as a Saishu which is a post assumed by women born from the Imperial family after the second world war.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Atsuko IKEDA, for example, now serves as a Saishu which is a post assumed by women born from the Imperial Family after the second world war.

sen.j: このことから斎宮と混同されることもあるが、斎宮は神宮に仕えた未婚の皇族女性のことで南北朝時代_(日本)に廃絶した。
sen.e: This may confuse some with Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine), but Saigu were the maiden imperial women who had served in shrines until the post abolished in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This post is sometimes confused with Saigu (an Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine), but Saigu were maiden imperial women who had served in shrines until the post was abolished in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: changed "This may confuse some with" to "This post is sometimes confused with"; eliminated "the" before "maiden";
sen.e: This post is sometimes confused with Saigu (an Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine), but Saigu were maiden imperial women who had served in shrines until the post was abolished in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 近代以降、社家の世襲が廃止されると、藤波家の世襲は廃され、華族をもって神宮祭主に任じた。
sen.e: With the abolishment of the hereditary system of shake (family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) in and after modern times, the inheritance of the post by the Fujinami family was abolished. The peerage was appointed Jingu saishu
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In modern times, the inheritance of the post by the Fujinami family was abolished as the hereditary system of shake (a family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) was repealed and the peerage was appointed to Jingu Saishu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処; combined the following sentence with this one for better flow; changed "abolishment" to "repealed"; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In modern times, the inheritance of the post by the Fujinami family was abolished as the hereditary system of shake (a family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) was repealed and the peerage was appointed to Jingu Saishu.

sen.j: のち皇族又は公爵をもって任じる親任官となり、勅令である神宮司庁官制で法制化された。
sen.e: Saishu later became an official appointed by the emperor to an imperial family member or duke and legally established by imperial edict for regulating the Ise Jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 「神宮司庁官制」は調べられませんでしたので、「伊勢神宮を管理する勅令」と訳してあります。
sen.e: Later on, Saishu became an official post appointed by the emperor to an imperial family member or duke and was legally established by imperial edict to regulate the Ise Jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: changed "Saishu later became" to "Later, Saishu became"; added "post" after "official"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Later on, Saishu became an official post appointed by the emperor to an Imperial Family member or duke and was legally established by imperial edict to regulate the Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 戦後は神道指令及び日本国憲法により、国家の手をはなれ、宗教法人としての神宮となった。
sen.e: After the war, the Ise Jingu Shrine has been no longer affiliated with the state and become a religious corporation under the Shinto Directive and the Constitution of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the war, the Ise Jingu Shrine was no longer affiliated with the state and became a religious corporation under the Shinto Directive and the Constitution of Japan.
sen.cmt: changed "has been no longer" to "was no longer";
sen.e: After the war, the Ise-jingu Shrine was no longer affiliated with the state and became a religious corporation under the Shinto Directive and the Constitution of Japan.

sen.j: 現在は宗教法人としての「規則」により、祭主は「勅旨を奉じて定める」ことされている。
sen.e: Now the "regulation" for the shrine as a religious corporation provide that "Saishu be appointed in obedience to an imperial order."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Currently the "regulation" for the shrine as a religious corporation provides that "Saishu are to be appointed in obedience to imperial order."
sen.cmt: changed "Now" to "Currently"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Currently the 'regulation' for the shrine as a religious corporation provides that 'Saishu are to be appointed in obedience to imperial order.'

sen.j: 女性の元皇族が就任している。
sen.e: A woman originally from the imperial family holds the post.
A woman originally from the imperial family assumes the post.
A woman originally from the Imperial Family assumes the post.

sen.j: 最初の皇族祭主が久邇宮朝彦親王であることから、その子孫が就任していることが多い。
sen.e: Because Imperial Prince Kuninomiya Asahiko was the first Saiishu of Imperial blood, her descendents tend to assume the post.
Due to the fact that Imperial Princess Kuninomiya Asahiko was the first Saishu of Imperial blood, her descendants often assume the post.
sen.cmt: changed "Because" to "Due to the fact that"; changed "Prince" to "Princess"; Saiishu→Saishu;
sen.e: Due to the fact that Imperial Princess Kuninomiya Asahiko was the first Saishu of Imperial blood, her descendants often assume the post.

sen.j: 熱田神宮にも祭主を置く動きがあったが、実現しなかった。
sen.e: Although Atsuta-jingu Shrine planned to set up the post of Saishu, the plan was not realized.
Although Atsuta-jingu Shrine had planned to set up a Saishu post, the plan was not implemented.
Although Atsuta-jingu Shrine had planned to set up a Saishu post, the plan was not implemented.
